name: Willy's Weirdy Nightmare
overview: Written in AMOS Professional. Coding by Richard Williams. Graphics & music by Steven Tate. Game features save game support and a quit back to WB option (by pressing CTRL-C). Based unofficially on 1984 Matthew Smith/Software Projects Spectrum release JET SET WILLY, but updated for the Amiga. . Each room has its own hazards, such as spikes, guardians (ranging from demonic heads to giant penknives), and ropes which can be climbed and grasped in mid-air. Touching a monster or a stationary hazard, or falling a great distance, causes instant loss of a life and places Willy back at the room entrance. The route through the house must be navigated carefully, due to the multiple entrances to some rooms - this is perhaps the first action game where mapping is an advantage.
